title: An Inside Look At Cubs‚Äô Visit With Obama At The White House
text:
An Inside Look At Cubs‚Äô Visit With Obama At The White House January 16, 2017 10:40 AM The Cubs celebrate their World Series championship. (Getty Images) 
CHICAGO (CBS) ‚Äî The Chicago Cubs World Series celebration train has not come to an end yet. 
The Chicago Cubs made a visit Monday to the White House to be honored by President Barack Obama for their World Series Champions title, before he leaves office. 
After the Cubs won the title last year, Obama, a longtime White Sox fan, tweeted an invitation. It happened: @Cubs win World Series. That's change even this South Sider can believe in. Want to come to the White House before I leave? 
‚Äî President Obama (@POTUS) November 3, 2016 
President Obama leaves office on Jan. 20, when President-Elect Donald Trump is sworn in as the nation‚Äôs 45th president. 
Cubs owners and most players are expected to be in Washington for the meeting with Obama. 
The meeting begins at noon. CBS 2 will be LIVE streaming the event on our website and Facebook page. CBS 2‚Äôs sports reporter Megan Mawicke will have a front-row view of the meeting and will be reporting from the event. 
Megan arrived Sunday and spoke with some players ahead of their big meeting with the President. 
‚ÄúWe get to meet the 44th President, so hopefully I can somehow give him a jersey with 44 on it,‚Äù said Chicago Cubs‚Äô first baseball Anthony Rizzo. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs going to be a lot of fun and we look forward to it.‚Äù 
Rizzo hinted that the No. 44 jersey would read RIZZOBAMA on the back. We will see if he follows through on that idea. 
The players also arrived Sunday night and have already been posting sneak previews of the experience on their social media. We have their inside looks below‚Ä¶ Chicago Cubs arrive at the White House (Cubs/Snapchat) 
Julianna Zobrist, wife of Chicago Cubs‚Äô second baseman Ben Zobrist posted Sunday on Instragram, a picture of her view from the plane going to D.C. 
And Cubs‚Äô pitcher, Pedro Strop posted a picture on Instagram with his wife, Yenni Valdez while on his flight, sticking to his Dominican roots with a caption written in spanish ‚ÄúCasa Blanca ma√±ana si dios quiere.‚Äù The comment translates to, ‚ÄòWhite house tomorrow, God willing.‚Äô 
We know Dexter Fowler likes to give gifts. He gave a sneak peak to the gift he will be presenting to President Barack Obama on Instagram. The caption read, ‚ÄúTop Secret @jumpman23 delivery for President @barackobama from me. Tune into @playerstribune Instagram tomorrow to see what‚Äôs inside.‚Äù 
What do you think is inside the box? 
Chicago Cubs‚Äô infielder, Javier Baez tweeted Monday morning, pointing out President Obama‚Äôs fandom to the Chicago White Sox and hoping he is ready for the Cubbies visit. I know Mr @BarackObama is a big WitheSox fan, but i hope he's ready for the Cubbies. üòâüí™üèΩüî• @Cubs #JB9 
‚Äî Javier B√°ez (@javy23baez) January 16, 2017 
He also posted a photo on Twitter, showing off his suit and wearing his sunglasses on his head, as usual. His post read, ‚ÄúExcited to be here in the White House. #JB9 #ElMago.‚Äù 
Alongside Javier Baez, teammate Willson Contreras posted on Instagram a photo of Javier Baez, Pedro Strop and himself, with a caption reading, ‚ÄúWith My Boys At White House Dimeloooo @javy23baez @pstroop‚Äù 
Suited up and ready to go, David Ross tweeted a picture with teammates ‚Äì Jason Heyward, Dexter Fowler, and Anthony Rizzo ‚Äì ready for the meeting with the President, stating they are ‚ÄúPresidential!‚Äù 
‚Äî David Ross (@D_Ross3) January 16, 2017 
He even had a run-in with American musician and songwriter, Jimmy Buffett. Just in the door and run into @jimmybuffett #daygettingbetter pic.twitter.com/hZaEesjmdg 
‚Äî David Ross (@D_Ross3) January 16, 2017 
Kris Bryant, David Ross and Anthony Rizzo posed in front of a White House podium, again feeling ‚ÄúPresidential!‚Äù 
Kris Bryant regrammed the photo. 
And speaking about suits‚Ä¶ The Chicago Cubs twitter page, tweeted some pictures of the players arriving ‚Äì all dressed to the nines ready for this history-making meeting. The tweet read, ‚ÄúSuit game strong. #CubsInDC‚Äù 
‚Äî Chicago Cubs (@Cubs) January 16, 2017 
It was not just the players who donned nice outfits ‚Äì their significant others dressed up too. 
Javier Baez‚Äôs girlfriend, Irmarie Marquez took to her social media platforms to share the special moment of the White House trip. 
The two posed for a picture with a statue head of Abraham Lincoln. ‚ÄúWhite House With My Man @javy23baez @Cubs‚Äù
